snippet: The increase in spending was largely a result of the tide of newly eligible beneficiaries in states that had expanded Medicaid, a Kaiser Family Foundation report said.
abstract: Kaiser Family Foundation report reveals Medicaid spending rose almost 14 percent on average in last fiscal year, in large part because of new enrollees in 29 states that expanded program under Affordable Care Act; shows per-member, per-month cost for new enrollees is equal to or lower than expect in those 29 states, and that additional spending was largely funded by federal government.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: The increase in spending was largely a result of the tide of newly eligible beneficiaries in states that had expanded Medicaid, a Kaiser Family Foundation report said.

headline.print_headline: Medicaid Costs Rise, but Some States Are Spared
headline.main: Medicaid Costs Rise, but Some States Are Spared
